span.p: Agent Complexity | Simple | Smart Required | Medium

span.p:
BEST OF BOTH WORLDS:
Use rules to decide when to be proactive

span.p:
RULE 2: Philosophical Question?
(e.g., 'How to apply Gita wisdom?')

WHEN TO USE:
Open-ended chat where
retrieval isn't always relevant

span.p:
‚úì Philosophical discussion
(agent decides if sources needed)

div.style: display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;

span.p:
‚úì Lower token usage
(only retrieve when needed)

div.style: display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;

span.p:
‚úì Faster for simple queries
(no unnecessary retrieval)

div.style: display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;

span.p:
‚úó Risk of missed retrievals
(agent might forget)

span.p:
WHEN TO USE:
High-stakes domains where
missing context is costly

span.p:
‚úì Bhagavad Gita verse lookup
(must retrieve exact verse)

div.style: display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;

div.span:
2. Auto-retrieve top-k results
BEFORE LLM inference

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
‚úó Slower response time
(retrieval on every turn)

div.style: display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;

span.p:
Does EVERY query
need external knowledge?
